DESCRIPTION:
b"This event was created in order to determine people's interest in a local march in solidarity with the March on Washington for Public Education taking place summer 2017.


In honor of the movement that began at the Women's March on Washington, the March for Public Education is a forum for teachers, counselors, professors, administrators, paraprofessionals, students, parents and citizen-advocates concerned with Secretary of Education Betsy DeVos, as well as federal, state and local policies that defund and devalue public education. We are advocates who believe that every child, regardless of race, sex, socioeconomic status and ability, deserve the opportunity to experience the transformative power of a well-rounded education.


MISSION: To promote public education through peaceful demonstration and action.


VISION

Public Schools will be safe, inclusive spaces for learning and critical thinking, where all children discover their passion(s) and role(s) as citizens. As members of March for Public Education, we aim to advance policy and recursively address issues of: equity, inclusion, accountability, a well-funded institution and the right to organize.


OUR PRINCIPLES

\xe2\x80\xa2 Schools must fight for equity. All students should enter the classroom on equal footing. Special educators, social workers, school psychiatrists, behavioral specialists, occupational therapists, and countless others are critical to creating an equitable school culture. Striving toward this ideal is the only way to create a meritocratic environment that is fair for all students.

\xe2\x80\xa2 Schools must strive to create a safe space for all. In this regard, schools have the recursive responsibility to combat racism, sexism, ableism, ethnocentrism, xenophobia, homophobia, and other prejudices.

\xe2\x80\xa2 Public education empowers children to discover their desires, passions and potential. In turn, children become tenacious adults who are critical thinkers, involved citizens and lifelong learners. The arts, humanities, mathematics, sciences and physical education are equally vital in developing the whole child.

\xe2\x80\xa2 Schools must be held accountable in the fight for equity. Accountability can include thoughtful standards and purposeful testing. These structures should strive to help schools provide a better education to students and should coincide with intentional professional development for teachers.

\xe2\x80\xa2 A well-funded public education is a right of all children, regardless of their intersectional identities. For profit educational institutions and their fundamental motivation for capital are incongruous in helping children realize their full identity.

\xe2\x80\xa2 Faculty and staff have the right and responsibility to organize. As members of the institution that is public education, stakeholders must challenge societal paradigms on behalf of students and the community."
NAME: March for Public Education Salt Lake City

DESCRIPTION:
b'Camp United Nations for Girls is a political leadership program that introduces girls ages 9  to 15 to international politics and the work of the United Nations. The program begins with a lesson on the history of the United Nations and its purpose. This is followed by an explanation of the structure, leadership and the rules of procedure of the United Nations starting with the General Assembly and subsidiary organs. Participants learn about the specific work undertaken in the United Nations\xe2\x80\x99 boards, commissions, committees, councils and panels and working groups. Prior to convening the General Assembly, each participant will be assigned a country and guided through researching her country then writing a position paper. When the General Assembly convenes delegates will give speeches, negotiate with other delegates, caucus and propose resolutions along with amendments before finally voting. All activities will be guided by a camp counselor in small working groups of delegates. Girl Scouts participating in Camp United Nations for Girls will earn a Girl Scouts Global Action Award. 


Camp United Nations for Girls is ideal for girls with an interest in politics. The delegate fee is $160. The Girl Scout delegate fee is $120. The delegate fee covers all program materials and meals. For additional information visit our website at www.girlsinpolitics.org, email 
[email\xc2\xa0protected]

DESCRIPTION:
b"This is our last Legislative Action Meeting for the 2017 session. We want to use this time together to appreciate what we've done together and reflect on what we can do better next session. Some questions we'll talk about:
-How do you feel about your work this session?
-What did we do as a group that was effective/engaging?
-What was missing that would have added to our work together?
-What should we change/not do again next time?
-Now that session is ending, how can we continue to be involved in local and state politics?
Please join us!"
NAME: SURJ MN Legislative Action Meeting

DESCRIPTION:
b'Corrections Corporation of America is one of the largest for profit prison companies making millions off the Mass Incarceration of Blacks and the Poor through lobbying, direct campaign contributions and increasing their influence politically. CCA was quoted in their 2014 Annual Report: "The demand for our facilities and services could be adversely affected by the relaxation of enforcement efforts, leniency in conviction or parole standards and sentencing practices or through the decriminalization of certain activities that are currently proscribed by our criminal laws. For instance, any changes with respect to drugs and controlled substances or illegal immigration could affect the number of persons arrested, convicted, and sentenced, thereby potentially reducing demand for correctional facilities to house them." Do not allow CCA to profit from Mass Incarceration. Join us in Protesting CCA's private industry for profit "slavery". 


UPDATE: The Corrections Corporation of America, GEO Group, and the Avalon Corporation all have facilities in the Austin, Texas area and Wells Fargo, Bank of America, Barclays Intl. and Merrlin Lynch have invested in private prisons. In honor of the Robert Sobukwe who lead a demonstration to a Soweto, South Africa police station on March 21, 1960 and those who lost their lives protesting apartheid and police brutality at the Sharpeville Massacre on March 21, 1960 at a Sharpeville police station, we will continue to uphold the date of March 21. We will make this a mass protest with organizations and advocates working to dismantle the prison industrial complex in the fields of mental health, rehabilitation, recidivsm, and criminal justice. 


FURTHER UPDATE: To avoid displacement of the residents of the Austin Transitional Center, 3154 East Highway 71, Austin, Texas 78617 we have moved this event to next year 2018 back to the GEO Group's new headquarters 1777 NE Loop 410, San Antonio, Texas 78217.'
NAME: Protest at Corrections Corporation of America: End Mass Incarceration

DESCRIPTION:
b'On May 20, 2017, activists around the world will, once again, unite to March Against Monsanto.


Tentatively, We plan on meeting at the Farmers Market at 1 to allow folks to partake of the farmers market, we will then March from the Farmers Market to Market Square at 1:15 PM to give time for Vendors to join us.  It should take us about 15 minutes to walk to Market Square where we will hold a visibility until 3 PM.


Why do we march?


Research studies have shown that Monsanto\xe2\x80\x99s genetically-modified foods can lead to serious health conditions such as the development of cancer tumors, infertility and birth defects. In the United States, the FDA, the agency tasked with ensuring food safety for the population, is steered by ex-Monsanto executives, and we feel that\xe2\x80\x99s a questionable conflict of interests and explains the lack of government-lead research on the long-term effects of GMO products. Recently, the U.S. Congress and president collectively passed the nicknamed \xe2\x80\x9cMonsanto Protection Act\xe2\x80\x9d that, among other things, bans courts from halting the sale of Monsanto\xe2\x80\x99s genetically-modified seeds.


For too long, Monsanto has been the benefactor of corporate subsidies and political favoritism. Organic and small farmers suffer losses while Monsanto continues to forge its monopoly over the world\xe2\x80\x99s food supply, including exclusive patenting rights over seeds and genetic makeup. Monsanto\xe2\x80\x99s GMO seeds are harmful to the environment; for example, scientists have indicated they have caused colony collapse among the world\xe2\x80\x99s bee population.


What are solutions we advocate for?


Vote with your dollar by buying organic and boycotting Monsanto owned companies that use GMOs in their products. Labeling of GMOs so that consumers can make those informed decisions easier. Repealing relevant provisions of the US\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x9cMonsanto Protection Act.\xe2\x80\x9d Calling for further scientific research on the health effects of GMOs. Holding Monsanto executives and Monsanto-supporting politicians accountable through direct communication, grassroots journalism, social media, etc. Continuing to inform the public about Monsanto\xe2\x80\x99s secrets. Taking to the streets to show the world and Monsanto that we won\xe2\x80\x99t take these injustices quietly. We will not stand for cronyism. We will not stand for poison. That\xe2\x80\x99s why we March Against Monsanto.'
NAME: Seacoast - March against Monsanto!

DESCRIPTION:
b'On Sunday, June 11, 2017, thousands of LGBTQ Americans and their allies will join in solidarity at sister marches across the country  marching for LGBTQ equality. Coinciding with the national Equality March for Unity and Pride, the sister march in Northwest Alabama will take place with a rally at Wilson Park, followed by a march through downtown Florence.
This event will also mark the one-year anniversary of the Pulse Nightclub tragedy in Orlando, where 49 people lost their lives.
Join Equality Shoals and other allied organizations and individuals as we rally and march to support and solidarity with the LGBTQ community.
2PM: Informational Tables
3PM: Rally
4PM: March
Equality Shoals is currently working on securing necessary permits and security for this event. This event is fluid and its schedule is subject to change.
If you are interested in helping to organize this march with Equality Shoals, or wish to table at this event, please send us a message through our website at https://www.equalityshoals.org/march.'
NAME: The Equality March for Unity and Pride - Florence, AL

DESCRIPTION:
b"Share! Spread the word! 
Save the date: June 14, 2017 is not only Flag Day, but also President Trump's birthday. 
Flag Day commemorates the adoption of the Flag of the United States. On National Flag Day, Americans are asked to honor what the American Flag represents, which is independence and unity. Two ideals that we believe America's current administration are in oppositon of. 
There is no better way to celebrate Flag Day, then to throw an anti-birthday party for President Trump while sending his administration a clear message through a true representation of independence and unity!
The Intersectionality Rally will provide all individuals, organizations, and groups an opportunity to raise awareness, allowing all that oppose this current administration and the systemic issues that existed long before this administration a chance to better acknowledge, understand, and utilize the differences among us! 
No matter your social catergoraization, all are invited as there are no barriers to entry. ALL ARE WELCOME. 
Let's send a clear message to the nation that we will not allow discriminatory and oppressive ideologies to keep those of us who believe in and value diversity from joining in a unified front as fights are not mutually exclusive! 
As this event comes together and permits are obtained, the location will be shared.
 If you want to collaborate, cosponsor, or have an idea, please send correspondence to: 
[email\xc2\xa0protected]

DESCRIPTION:
b'We occupy Dean Heller's Office in defense of our nation's most vulnerable.
We will flood his office and the hall outside we will chant "I am a pre existing condition" for a few moments and then fall out dead. 
WE DO NOT MOVE UNTIL HELLER GOES ON NATIONAL TV AND VOWS TO NEVER SUPPORT A FORM OF HEALTHCARE THAT INCREASES COST AND LIMITS COVERAGE. 
LVMP will have to drag our lifeless bodies, pile our corpses in the elevator to bring us to the street for tresspassing citations. 
This will create horrific imagery that they will NEVER LIVE DOWN.
Our tax dollars pay for his office to be on private property. 
We reclaim what is ours in the name of saving the lives of those too sick to fight. 
This is a peaceful and non violent demonstration intended to illustrate the harsh reality of how the #AHCA AKA #Trumpcare will destroy the lives of millions.
The ACLU will be on notice for legal representation if necessary. 
Come commited comrades. We do not back down!
#Resist #Disrupt #Persist'
LOCATION: 8930 W Sunset Rd Las Vegas, Nv 89148
NAME: Die In To Occupy Dean Heller's Office

DESCRIPTION:
b'This march is to be held at every college campus.  Shut down the campus, in a non-violent manner.  Block parking lots.  Have a sit-in on the major areas of your campus.
Student debt is out of control.  
No one should not go to college just because they cannot afford it.  We all have a right to a basic college degree, without a college degree citizens of this country get left behind.  
It is time for the government to look out for its citizens.  
We are asking for the federal government to give us debt-free bachelor's degree.  
We want the government to "eat" the college debt currently out there.  
"Eating" the debt will free the young generation to buy and spend freely if not our economy will suffer greatly from a generation that cannot stimulate the economy.  
It is the only way.'
NAME: Student Debt Protest

This will be rescheduled to the end of next year of 2017 to allow for further planning and with the goal of starting KWANZAA on the correct date of December 26, outreach to all Africans of the Diaspora, IMMIGRATION CLINIC for Africans of the Diaspora, and a BAZAAR for Africans of the Diaspora to showcase their businesses.  We direct people to Elizabeth Kahura's "Kwanzaa Celebration" on December 30, 2016 at the Carver Museum and Theatre for the time being.


Amadou Diallo of Guinea killed February 4, 1999 in New York City, NY. Jonathan Deng of Sudan killed July 24, 2009 in Iowa City, Iowa. Charley  "Africa" Keunang of Cameroon killed March 1, 2015 in Los Angeles, CA. Deng Manyoun of Sudan killed June 14, 2015 in Louisville, Kentucky. #BlackLivesMatter We will march from 9th and Chicon near Hutson-Tillotson on the East Side through downtown and back to the East Side to Hutson-Tillotson.'
NAME: African Drum March: In Memory of African Immigrants Killed by Police

DESCRIPTION :  INDIVISIBLE SUFFRAGISTS are in solidarity of the many Indivisible Actions inspired by the Indivisible Guide and Indivisible Groups Nationwide. The purpose of the INDIVISIBLE MARCH is to organize our resistance efforts more effectively and unify the accomplishments of more than 5,982 registered Indivisible Groups in the United States of America. We welcome you to take leadership as a Community Organizer in collaborating with other like-minded political activists to celebrate The Resistance.


PROMOTION : We suggest that Host(s) create a FREE website via weebly.com or, if applicable, use your current Indivisible Group website for "Host Contact Info". That way Marchers can receive updates directly from your Indivisible Group site up until the last minute if your local INDIVISIBLE MARCH and Rally schedule changes.  


LOCATION : Location subject to change based upon required permits. Although "Congress shall make no law respecting an establishment of religion, or prohibiting the free exercise thereof; or abridging the freedom of speech, or of the press; or the right of the people peaceably to assemble, and to petition the Government for a redress of grievances", WE THE PEOPLE must abide by local laws that may limit the time, place and manner of such protests, to balance the rights of others and the safety of the community.  


PARKING : TBA


TRANSPORTATION : TBA


DATE : The date of August 26th was purposefully chosen for the 1st Annual INDIVISIBLE MARCH. Women in the United States were granted the right to vote on August 26, 1920, when the 19th Amendment to the United States Constitution was certified as law. Thus in 1971, August 26th became designated as "Women's Equality Day" in America. We intend to acknowledge the 97th Anniversary of the 19th Amendment in 2017 and beyond. Please help us to organize this historic event in a safe, legal and peaceful manner to uplift ALL Indivisible Groups across the United States as we commemorate the countdown to the 100th anniversary of the 19th Amendment in 2020.


TIME : 1:00 PM - 5:00 PM unless otherwise stated.


RALLY : Schedule of Rally Speaker(s) and Entertainment TBA.


ROUTE : TBA via mapmywalk.com


RSVP : Please RSVP to confirm your INDIVISIBLE MARCH attendance. Marcher(s) registration ticket(s) are electronic (Zero Waste) and FREE. To RSVP for various cities and states, research our Indivisible March Facebook Page and click on Events and/or enter your ZIP CODE via indivisibleguide.com and click on Act Locally to search by type "Indivisible Action". You may receive updates via Facebook and E-MAIL from Indivisible March Network, the sponsor of this event.'
LOCATION: Library Mall? 728 State Steet, Madison, WI 53706
NAME: Indivisible MARCH Madison

DESCRIPTION:
b'We are marching in an effort to promote global awareness over the issue of genetically modified organisms (GMOs) and cancer-linked herbicides in the food supply. 


Glyphosate, the cancer-linked herbicide that is an essential component in the expansion of GMO crops, is already being banned around the world over safety concerns. Here in the United States, glyphosate is consistently being discovered in everything from hospital feeding tubes and tampons to the breast milk of nursing mothers.  


March Against Monsanto will launch its 4th global street march in protest of Monsanto and GMOs on May 20th, 2017.'
NAME: March Against Monsanto

DESCRIPTION: b'Join Somos America and People Demanding Action Arizona for this special meeting with guest speaker, Roberto Reveles.\nActivist burnout is a serious problem for us and our coalition partners! Our dedicated volunteers are trying to change the world and we all can put too much of the progressive movement on to our own shoulders. Come learn about ways to prevent and recover from these periods of burnout!\nWe are lucky to have guest speaker Roberto Reveles. He is a long-time activist for the Latino and immigrant communities. He is the founder of Somos America and former board president of the American Civil Liberties Union of Arizona. He campaigned with Cesar Chavez, and helped organize the biggest political demonstration in Arizona history in 2006. He was honored in 2014 at the Stylos Awards for his lifetime work.'
NAME: PDaction AZ: Activism & Burnout

This year we will elect a new executive committee and it's up to you to decide the direction our Party will take. This is not the official Party event page. This is a page created by Rob Miller to inform and invite Utah residents who are interested in knowing more about our Utah Democratic Party."
NAME: Utah State Democratic Party Convention

DESCRIPTION:
b"The Betsy De Vos confirmation has shaken me. I'm not surprised it happened, but I am still sickened by it. 


That's my son in the picture for this event. He's got something called Fragile X Syndrome and so does one of his sisters. They both have IEP's, amazing teachers and clean, safe schools to attend. 


Our oldest kid is the opposite: graduated High School two years early with the ability to concentrate on her passion in art. My kid's lives are made possible by their Free & Appropriate Public Education.


My husband and I have had the privilege to work in business sectors that continue to provide us with the resources to live in an area with exceptional Public Education. We are lucky. 


I'm sick because of the millions of kids who won't be ok if De Vos is able to exert her agenda on the children of this country. Vulnerable kids in all communities from coast to coast. 


All options need to remain on the table and be accessible by any family in America! Homeschool, Private school, Public school! And when families need access to Special Education Services, they must be available and guaranteed on the Federal level!


De Vos' ignorance of IDEA, Public School, non-religious based Home Schooling and many other crucial pieces to education is petrifying.


Join me, bring your friends and let's show our resistence to De Vos on May 17th, 2017, the 60th anniversary of Brown vs. Board decision on the streets of New York City.


This date was chosen because children of color in the United States continue to be underserved, under protected, under educated and under represented. A De Vos reign will ensure NOTHING will change for the better. We have an obligation to fight for these children most of all."
NAME: Equal Rights Education March

The committee is involved in event planning and will be in the forefront of all the exciting new developments through YWCA Helena!  Get involved, we'd love to have you.\nMeetings are held every second Thursday of the month."

DESCRIPTION:
b"Harrison, AR has long been called \xe2\x80\x9cthe most racist little town in America\xe2\x80\x9d, and the actions and posturing of the Knights of the Ku Klux Klan out of their headquarters in Zinc have not gone unnoticed. We see the consequences of white supremacy at work in our communities every day. It is time for Arkansans to unite in solidarity with our black and brown brothers and sisters against the Klan and those that sympathize with and enable their posturing in our communities; to show that Arkansas will not be defined by the Ku Klux Klan, but by those of us who stand firm on the right side of justice and history.  Whether you walk with God, family, partners or friends, please join us on the Harrison square, at 2PM on Saturday, May 27th.


For more information, please contact us via e-mail, or by phone call or text message:

[email\xc2\xa0protected]

DESCRIPTION:
b'What: Strong presence at the DRBC Public Meeting Wednesday, May 17.
Where: Washington Crossing State Park Visitor Center, 1112 River Road, Washington Crossing, Pa.
When: Arrive by 1:00 pm, meeting starts at 1:30 pm. 
Troubling signs that the Delaware River Basin Commission (DRBC) may be lifting its seven year moratorium on gas drilling brought hundreds of people to the February and March DRBC meetings in Washington Crossing, PA. We spoke loud and clear: Ban Fracking in the Delaware River Watershed Now!
On May 17 the DRBC will hold its meeting to consider various permits throughout the Basin. Although there is no public comment session at this meeting, we want to be present to represent all of our communities that oppose drilling and will never allow its devastation to occur on this Wild and Scenic River and in this watershed that supplies 17 million people with drinking water.
Please come and be counted with other representatives of organizations that support a frack ban and municipalities that have passed a resolution calling for a DRBC ban. 
NOW IS THE TIME to enact a permanent ban on all gas development, including drilling and fracking, in the Delaware River Watershed. Take action right now by signing the Petition: http://petitions.moveon.org/sign/ban-fracking-in-the-delaware-1
The time could change and more details will follow so please sign up to go and get updates about the action at: https://goo.gl/forms/wAlCzAGO2DYpm6Xn2'
NAME: Be Counted! Stand for a DRBC Frack Ban May 17

DESCRIPTION:
b'ANNOUNCING OUR NEXT BIG BAKE AMERICA GREAT EVENT!
In February, a Bake America Great inspired bake sale movement for Planned Parenthood raised over $30,000 in one weekend. 
***Please join our POTLUCK REVOLUTION for refugees and immigrants!*** 
1. Tell us you're in with a comment here!
2. We will be posting tips, recipes, and sample invitations to host your own potluck.
3. Create your own local event invite using our tile - invite your friends through social media and/or email. 
4. On May 6th - or anytime in May - gather with friends, family, and neighbors. Raise a toast, raise your spirits, and help us raise some "dough" for GREAT causes!
5. Post your pics on social media, tagging us and Miry's List and/or International Rescue Committee. Be sure to use #BakeAmericaGreat #MirysList -- We're on Instagram (@BakeAmericaGreat) and Twitter (@bakeUSamerica), too!
6. Send the proceeds directly to the International Rescue Committee, Miry's List (we'll be posting instructions here, if you need them), or through CrowdRise (link to follow).
THAT'S IT! GRASSROOTS ACTIVISM FROM YOUR OWN NEIGHBORHOOD. 
LET'S RAISE A TOAST, RAISE OUR SPIRITS AND RAISE SOME DOUGH FOR A GREAT CAUSE!
Remember to share this far and wide! Ask your friends to join the #SweetResistance. We're #StrongerTogether! 
International Rescue Committee: https://www.rescue.org/
Miry's List: https://www.miryslist.org'
NAME: Potlucks for Miry's List & the International Rescue Committee

If you have any questions or concerns feel free to message us! We look forward to seeing you all soon!'
NAME: PALS Potluck in the Park

DESCRIPTION:
b'A Screening and Q/A of Two Award-Winning Short Films; Fireplace & Orshena. By Directors Muhammad & Samah Safi Bayazid
$5 (Online. BUY them now!) | $8 (At the Door): 
http://syrianculturalhouse.org/tc-events/short-fil...
About the Films:
Fireplace:
Inspired by true events.
It is Christmas Eve in Syria; a small child plays hide and seek with his dad and picks the most unexpected place to hide in: the fireplace. Within a few seconds, a jet fighter bombards their house to the ground. The fireplace stands still; however, the small child finds himself trapped alone.
Omran Daqneesh is probably the most famous Syrian child. He survived an airstrike on his family's house. Fireplace tells the story of Ali, Omran's little brother who was not lucky enough to survive the bombardment.
Orshena
Inspired by true events.
Orshena means "Land of Peace" in the ancient Syriac language.
An old man loses his youngest daughter while migrating to Europe on a rubber boat. The accident changes his life forever. He keeps imagining his daughter everywhere he goes, while trying to make peace with himself.
----------------
About the Directors:
Muhammad Bayazid
Muhammad is an award-winning Syrian filmmaker who studied filmmaking at the Los Angeles Film School and London Film School. He also studied screenwriting at the BBC, NYFA, and the Screenwriters University.
Muhammad has directed many TV commercials, public service announcements, TV programs, and documentaries. He is also known for teaching filmmaking courses around the world.
Muhammad recently directed two seasons of Inspiration, an American mini-series drama. He has also directed the award-winning film Orshena that talks about refugees.
Muhammad has previously been awarded the 2016 Award of Excellence - The IndieFEST \xe2\x80\x93 California (USA) 2016; the 2016 ICDA, Dubai (UAE); and the 2011 "Best Creative Short Film", LAFF, US awards.
Samah Safi Bayazid
Samah is a 28 year old award-winning filmmaker who lives in Washington DC. She studied filmmaking and screenwriting at the New York Film Academy in New York City. Samah started working professionally in the filmmaking industry at the age of 22, becoming one of the pioneers among professional Arab filmmakers in the industry. Samah has merged her passion for faith with filmmaking to produce unique humanitarian entertainment for audiences across the world, with short films, PSAs, TV campaigns, TV programs, documentaries, drama series, and music videos.
She produced Inspiration, an American mini-series drama with her husband, Director Muhammad Bayazid, who is both her life and work partner.
Her latest film Orshena has been officially selected for many international film festivals and recently won the Award of Excellence at the Indie Film Festival in California.
Her latest PSA Islamophobia addresses the phenomenon in the United States, went viral on social media, and got over 15 million views in just a few days. Samah also worked with Swedish artist Maher Zain on his music video Muhammad about the love for the prophet Muhammad PBUH. It has over 14 million views on YouTube.'
NAME: Syria Short Films Screening & Q&A

DESCRIPTION:
b'Les Leopold
, author and director of the New York-based Labor Institute, will be speaking in the Bay Area May 17-20 about his latest book, 
Runaway Inequality: An Activist's Guide to Economic Justice. 
The talks will be interactive workshops, demonstrating how runaway inequality links many progressive movements together \xe2\x80\x93 including labor, environment, Black Lives Matter, healthcare for all, and immigration reform. The tour is co-sponsored by local Indivisible chapters, Rootcamp, and The Incorruptibles. 
Salon.com says: "
Runaway Inequality
 doesn't just explain where the U.S. economy went wrong; it also explains how American citizens can organize to get it back on track."

DESCRIPTION:
b"WHAT AND WHY?
PPSATis hosting drives across the state of WV with the help of Community Volunteers.
Our mission is to provide products to those in need as well as educate folks about the struggles people face regarding menstruation and access to products. Some people miss school or work because of lack of access, and some must use products that are unsanitary or unsafe. This must change.
HOW CAN I HELP?
Donate tampons, pads, menstrual cups, underwear, and other feminine hygiene products to the drop-off site.
Collect products at places of work, schools, or community events and donate to the dropoff site.
If you would like to donate money for products or send packages, contact Emily Thompson at 
[email\xc2\xa0protected]

Donations from this drive will be give to the Children's Home Society and the Senandoah Women's Center in Berkeley County. 
Women, girls, and members of the LGBTQ+ community who can not afford products will benefit. People should not go without a necessity like feminine hygiene products."

DESCRIPTION:
b"Gun violence kills more than 90 Americans a day and injures hundreds more. That\xe2\x80\x99s why this June 2nd on National Gun Violence Awareness Day, aka #WearOrange Day, Americans across the country will #WearOrange\xe2\x80\x94a color that demands to be seen\xe2\x80\x94sending the powerful message that there is more we can do to end gun violence.


Join Hamilton County Moms on June 3rd for a FREE #WearOrange Day gathering featuring an optional beginning yoga session, fun for the kids, and lots of gun-violence awareness. 


Bring the kids so they can create their own, personalized pictures and messages of peace with colorful sidewalk chalk!


Don't forget your yoga mat or towel, and a water bottle and #WearOrange! (And if orange just isn't your color, don't worry, we'll save you a button!)


SOCIAL MEDIA:

June 2nd and 3rd\xe2\x80\x94Take a selfie with the hashtag #WearOrange and your favorite orange bling. Then share on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter! And don't pass up a chance to snap a pic in front of one of the glowing #WearOrange landmarks! The Carmel Fountain will be sparkling with orange lights, and the IPL building in downtown Indy will be an absolutely breathtaking must see!


RSVP Here: http://act.everytown.org/event/wear-orange-2017_attend/6231"
NAME: Wear Orange ? Gun Violence Awareness and Peace Through Yoga!

DESCRIPTION:
b'ATTENTION ALL BOOK NERDS, ACTIVISTS, ARTICLE-SCROLLERS, NETFLIX-WATCHERS AND SOCIAL JUSTICE WARRIORS:
Do you love justice and also reading?? What about deepening your understanding of racism and classism in America while Netflix bingeing? Do you need a way to open up conversations about race and activism with your family and friends?! Then do we have the book club for you!
Join us on May 21st, 2PM on the Google machine for our SURJ-ATL Book Club Launch Party, where we'll give you the tools and resources to start your very own Antiracist Book Club. Think of it like a pyramid scheme, a pyramid scheme of justice. Except this time, the only person getting ripped off is the Man. 
Our first book club titles will be:
"The Case for Reparations" by Ta-Nehisi Coates, first published in The Atlantic
"The 13th" by director Ava DuVernay
"Nickel and Dimed" by Barbara Ehrenreich
Can't wait to see you there!'
NAME: Book Club Launch Party!

DESCRIPTION: b'People of any race, gender, sexuality, age, ability, or class are welcome. We encourage people to learn and ask questions at our events. With that in mind, this space can be challenging for those with less privilege.\nWe\'ll watch and discuss the documentary Anne Braden: Southern Patriot (70 minutes). Snacks will be provided. Conference Room B\nAnne Braden: Southern Patriot is a first person documentary about the extraordinary life of this American civil rights leader. Braden was hailed by Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. in his 1963 Letter from Birmingham Jail as a white southerner whose rejection of her segregationist upbringing was "eloquent and prophetic". Ostracized as a "red" in the 1950s, she fought for an inclusive movement community and mentored three generations of social justice advocates. Braden\'s story explores not only the dangers of racism and political repression but also the power of a woman\'s life spent in commitment to social justice.'
NAME: Challenging Perspectives - Anne Braden film screening

DESCRIPTION:
b"Please join Safe Out and the LGBTQ Consortium for safeTALK, a training to help increase your knowledge and ability to reach out to prevent suicide through connecting individuals at risk to help. This workshop is open to everyone, regardless of prior experience or education. safeTALK is great for caregivers, teachers, community and youth leaders, and just anyone that just wants to help keep LGBTQ folks safe - including your friends and family. It's also open to all communities although Safe Out has a special emphasis on preventing suicide in the LGBTQ community. 


By the end of this free training, you will become a resource within the community to help identify, support, and connect people with the care they need and deserve. This event is free and open to the community, but you must be 15 or older to attend.


Mercy Maricopa Integrated Care (MMIC) and Safe Out are committed to creating safer communities in Maricopa County and equipping more individuals with the skills to reach out and support one another. As such, MMIC and Safe Out are supporting all costs of this workshop, which is valued at $25 per person, so that it can be free of charge to you.


For any questions, please contact 
[email\xc2\xa0protected]

DESCRIPTION:
b'Visit webpage and register to march in DC: http://www.equalitymarch2017.com
(Washington, DC) 
The Equality March for Unity and Pride named a diverse group of leaders with years of advocacy and community mobilization in LGBTQ+ liberation movements across the country and the world as 12 of its national co-chairs. The co-chairs will be responsible for guiding the ongoing development of the march, which will take place on June 11 in Washington, DC. 
"This is the most diverse national executive committee of any of the past five LGBTQ+ marches in Washington" said San Diego City Commissioner and National Co-Chair Nicole Murray Ramirez, who has served on the national organizing committees of all five past Marches in Washington. "From queer youth, Two-Spirit members, Transgender, Black Lives Matter activists, Undocumented, Immigrant, to HRC, AmFar, and various organizations. The Equality March and the rally stage will indeed truly represent the changing faces of the U.S. and of our LGBTQ+ movement."
Inspired by the queer liberation movement's history of diverse, inclusive, and politically resonant public demonstrations, the Equality March for Unity and Pride will elevate and mobilize LGBTQ+ communities by highlighting those who, historically, have been actively silenced and neglected in the fight for full liberation, so that we may find unity and strength through diversity. The march is centered on the principle that in order to heal from the decades of neglect and erasure of marginalized people in the community, we must center transgender and gender expansive communities, and people of color. The co-chairs demand the inclusion of those left behind by social justice movements, including Black, Latinx, Bisexual, and differently-abled individuals. The co-chairs firmly believe that the community finds strength in diversity, and that the current political and social movement demands not just solidarity, but work towards intentional equity, representation, and protection of the most vulnerable. 
Equality March planners are working in coordination with the National Parks Service. Further details on the logistics of the march will be released in the coming weeks. 
Sister marches are planned in more than 25 cities across the country for June 11 in solidarity with the March's mission to support the ongoing struggle for rights and safety for all LGBTQ+ individuals and families with similar emphasis on queer people of color,transgender, and gender nonconforming communities.
"As a cis gay white male of privilege, I recognize that for far too long certain members of LGBTQ+ Communities have been underserved both here in the United States and abroad," said national co-chair David Bruinooge. "They need to finally be given the same equity, equality, visibility, protection, access, liberties, justice, and inclusion as the most privileged among us in the ongoing struggle for LGBTQ+ liberation. This movement is an opportunity for LGBTQ+ communities to move forward together in solidarity and ensure together that all all our voices will not be silenced by those who want to roll back previous progress or impede necessary future change."
"Transgender people are at the front lines of every movement from immigration and reproductive justice to the fight for Black Lives Matter yet our realities and experiences need to be centered and our voices amplified," said Catalina Velasquez, Senior Director of Strategic Partnerships and Communications at Casa Ruby,President of Consult Catalina, and Board Vice-Chair of Our Revolution. She is the first undocumented transgender woman appointed Commissioner of the DC Mayor's Office of Latino Affairs, and a national co-chair of the March. "Sexual and Gender liberation are key in our resistance to the current anti-immigrant and anti-transgender administration and the ongoing slaughter of transgender people of color. I am part of this march so the T in LGBTQ+ is not a footnote or a lost addendum in an everyday larger acronym. I march because there are 11.2 million undocumented immigrants of which hundreds of thousands are LGBTQ+ facing persecution, detention, and deportation to a death sentence, yet we see little to no public outcry. I march because pride is an act of resistance in a world where over 80 countries criminalize people based on sexual orientation and/or gender identity."
Our national Co-Chairs include: 
1.
Anika Simpson, Ph.D.
, Founder, Beyond Policy LLC | Associate Professor of Women's & Gender Studies and Philosophy at Morgan State University | Pronouns: She, Her, Hers
2.
Ashley Smith
, The Capital Pride Alliance | Human Rights Campaign Foundation, Board Member | Pronouns: He, Him, His
3.
Catalina Velasquez
, Consult Catalina President | Casa Ruby Senior Director of Strategic Partnerships and Communications | Washington DC Mayor's Office of Latino Affairs Commissioner | Our Revolution Board Vice Chair | GetEqual Board Co-Chair | Megaphone Strategies Board Member | Inclusv Board Member | Trans United Fund Board Member | United We DREAM's Queer Undocumented Immigrant Project (QUIP) Advisory Council | Pronouns: She, Her, Hers, Trans Goddess.
4.
David Bruinooge
, Founder: The Equality March for Unity & Pride | Pronouns: He, Him, His
5.
Elle Hearns
, Executive Director of The Marsha P Johnson Institute | Pronouns: She, Her, Hers
6.
Jos\xc3\xa9 L. Plaza
, President, Latino GLBT History Project | Chair, DC Latino Pride | Executive Board Member, DC New Leaders Council | Pronouns: He, Him, His
7.
Lydia X. Z. Brown
, Chairperson of the Massachusetts Developmental Disabilities Council | At-large board member of the Autism Women's Network | Pronouns: They, Them, Theirs
8.
Lynnette McFadzen
, President, BiNet USA | Producer, The BiCast | Core Organizer | The Bi Brigade | Pronouns: They/Them She/Hers
9.
Nicole Murray Ramirez
, International Court System, U.S.A., Canada and Mexico | Harvey Milk Foundation | Pronouns: He, Him, His
10.
Sean Coleman
, Executive Director, Destination Tomorrow | Board Member, Transgender Legal Defense and Education Fund (TLDEF) | Pronouns: He, Him, His
11.

, Co-President, InterPride | Strategic Planning Director, NYCPride | Pronouns: She/her/hers 
12.
Thomas Tonatiuh Lopez,
 The International Indigenous Youth Council | Standing Rock Activist | Two-Spirit & Indigenous Activist | Pronouns: He, Him, His'

DESCRIPTION:
b"Join hundreds of climate advocates in Washington, D.C. this summer for the 8th Annual Citizens' Climate Lobby/Citizens' Climate Education's International Conference & Lobby Day.
During the Conference June 11-12th, you'll hear from inspiring speakers and receive training to be game-changing communicators on this issue.
The tipping point for the political will to price carbon is getting closer. Thanks to the diligent efforts of our citizen volunteers, in 2016 we saw:
-The growth of Representatives on the Gibson Resolution
-The birth and rapid growth of the House Bipartisan Climate Solutions Caucus
Will this be the year we reach that tipping point? Be part of the power surge in D.C. for our Lobby Day on June 13th to do what we do best: having conversations that lead to the breakthroughs necessary to enact effective climate solutions."

These office hours are always a great opportunity to meet staff and develop a dialogue with your Congressmans' staff. While they cannot always speak on positions, they can pass along concerns and share stories with the Congressman.'

DESCRIPTION:
b'There's a movement sweeping the nation that's standing up for women's rights. Women's health continues to come second for many decision makers and it's clear that now, more than ever, we need to send a message to Congress that our health is nonnegotiable. 
That's why, in cooperation with Representative Grace Meng, Women's Voices has partnered with Seventh Generation and The Honest Company to speak out in Washington, DC on May 23 to demand our right to safe feminine care products. We invite you to join us to show your support!
A woman will use over 17,000 tampons in her lifetime. Yet, a woman currently doesn't have the right to know what ingredients are being used in tampons or pads. This is unacceptable. 
It's unacceptable that toxic chemicals like talc, formaldehyde releasers and parabens can be used in feminine wipes, douches, feminine washes and feminine deodorant products. Black and Latina women bear the burden of exposure because they tend to be higher users of these products.
As Gloria Steinem said at the women's march \xe2\x80\x9cThank you for understanding that sometimes we must put our bodies where our beliefs are." 
That's exactly what we intend to do on May 23 and we hope that you can join us! 
If you can't attend in person, there will be day-of actions you can take.
For now, save the date and stay tuned on this event page more details! 
In solidarity!
(Rally official time TBD)'
NAME: Rally for Safe Feminine Care Products

DESCRIPTION:
b"You're invited to one of the most interactive global youth programs in Kansas City! Students from across the country will meet at the University of Missouri - Kansas City Campus to develop cultural knowledge and leadership skills through the dynamic itinerary of: 
\xe2\x80\xa2	Expert International Panel Discussions
\xe2\x80\xa2	Breakout Exercises
\xe2\x80\xa2	Team Building Sessions
\xe2\x80\xa2	Community Service
\xe2\x80\xa2	Tours of Kansas City and PTPI Headquarters
The theme for the 2017 Global Youth Conference is Global Peace Reconciliation. Through a comprehensive curriculum that educates attendees on peace conflict around the world, students will be able to address pressing global issues while maintaining mutual respect for other cultures.
Featured Speakers Include:
- Lynne M. Jackson, Founding President of the Dred Scott Heritage Foundation
- Steve Youngblood, Director, Center for Global Peace Journalism at Park University
- Dr. Dean Bartholomew, Director of Anthropology at the University of Kansas 
- plus a few more knowledgable speakers in the area of Peace Conflict & Reconciliation! 
Registration is open!"
NAME: 2017 Global Youth Forum

DESCRIPTION:
b'The world feels profoundly different from even just a couple years ago, and the word \xe2\x80\x9cpopulism" is often used to describe this shift. But what is populism, exactly? How did we get here, and have we been here before?
Join Humanities Washington's for a casual exploration of populism at our next Think & Drink event.
Massive movements like the Tea Party and The Resistance vow to stop the President at every turn. Candidates are raging against the very government they seek to lead. Bernie Sanders's candidacy\xe2\x80\x94and Donald Trump's victory\xe2\x80\x94were fueled by fury against an entrenched political class. And across the Atlantic, that same anger propelled Britain's exit from the European Union and the rise of far-right candidates like Geert Wilders and Marine Le Pen.
What fuels populism\xe2\x80\x94is it political gridlock, globalism, job loss, the urban/rural divide, racial resentment, fear of terrorism? How does populism on the left and the right differ, and how is it the same?
Join us for "Burn It Down: A Beginner's Guide to Populism" for an exploration of the rise of populism in the US and Europe, and try to make sense of this tense moment in national and international politics. This event features Cornell Clayton, director of the Thomas S. Foley Institute for Public Policy and Public Service at Washington State University; and Nick Barr Clingan, director of international programs for the Comparative History of Ideas Program at the University of Washington. Hosted by KUOW's Ross Reynolds.
Humanities Washington's Think and Drink events are hosted conversations at pubs and tasting rooms on provocative topics and new ideas. 
Media sponsor: KUOW'
NAME: Think and Drink Seattle: A Beginner's Guide to Populism

DESCRIPTION:
b"Since November 2016, over 2,000 companies have stopped advertising on Breitbart News. Let's make sure Amazon is next!


Join us for a rally at Amazon\xe2\x80\x99s shareholder meeting in Seattle during its annual shareholder meeting as we urge Amazon to stop advertising on Breitbart, a hate speech website that espouses sexist, racist, xenophobic, and bigoted rhetoric. 


We will fly a plane over Amazon's shareholder meeting with our message and deliver over 1.2 million petition signatures urging Amazon to drop Breitbart!


This event is organized by Care2, The Representation Project, MoveOn, Ultraviolet, SumofUs, and Sleeping Giants. 


If you haven't, add your name to the petitions:

\xe2\x80\xa2 care2.com/go/z/Breitbart

\xe2\x80\xa2 moveon.org/Amazon_Breitbart

\xe2\x80\xa2 act.weareultraviolet.org/sign/amazon-breitbart/

\xe2\x80\xa2 https://actions.sumofus.org/a/amazon-stop-investing-in-hate 


View the list of companies that have already dropped Breitbart: http://bit.ly/2gcSNvW


*Note: By choosing to attend this event, you are acknowledging the risks involved, and you are committing to participate nonviolently and in accordance with the law, and to work to de-escalate confrontations with opposing persons or others. You agree (i) not to engage in any act of violence or violation of any applicable law and (ii) to obey the orders of authorized event marshals and law enforcement authorities."
LOCATION: Fremont Studios, 155 N 35th St. Seattle, WA 98103

DESCRIPTION:
b'Ozark Indivisible is planning a #MarchforTruth to coincide with the national effort on Saturday, June 3rd.  The starting location locally will be the Frisco Stage in downtown Rogers.  Relevant and easy to carry signs are welcome, and encouraged.  After a few speakers 
at the Stage, we will march a couple of blocks alongside Walnut Avenue and then march back.  
Our purpose is to stand united with the overwhelming majority of Americans who believe an impartial investigation into Russia and their interactions with Trump and those in his campaign, is necessary. A new poll came out that says 78% of Americans want an independent investigation into #TrumpRussia. 
http://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/nbc-wsj-poll-just-29-percent-approve-trump-s-firing-n759196
The legitimacy of our democracy is more important than the interests of any party, or any President. So, we will rise together to call for a fair and impartial investigation, for the pursuit of truth, and for the restoration of faith in our electoral system and the Office of the Presidency.
Hosted by Ozark Indivisible in coordination with Indivisible Eureka Springs, Boone County Indivisible, Indivisible Ozarks NCA, Indivisible Fort Smith, NWA Resistance, NWA Progressives, Be the Change Alliance AR, Arkansas for the New Conservative Movement,  and other concerned citizen groups in AR.'
NAME: March for Truth- Nationwide
ORGANIZER: Frisco Stage S 1st St, Rogers, AR 72756

DESCRIPTION: b'Vashon SURJ hosts monthly meetings for people committed to showing up for racial justice. Predominantly a group of white people, we focus on deepening our understanding of our role in undoing systemic & individual racism, developing new & reporting  on current actions, & expanding outreach to other Vashonites. This meeting will include discussion of the May21st Active Bystander Training.'
NAME: Vashon SURJ Monthly Meeting

DESCRIPTION:
b"Mark your calendars! Boulder Friend's Meeting, Showing Up for Racial Justice Boulder, Unitarian Universalist Church of Boulder, and Rocky Mountain Peace and Justice Center are co-hosting a presentation with Debby Irving, author of the award-winning book, Waking Up White, and Finding Myself in the Story of Race.


Debby will use historical and media images to tell the story of how she unlearned her white-skewed belief system. This workshop is designed to support white people in making the paradigm shift from \xe2\x80\x98fixing\xe2\x80\x99 and \xe2\x80\x98helping\xe2\x80\x99 those believed to be \xe2\x80\x9cneedy,\xe2\x80\x9d to focusing on internalized sense of white superiority and its role in perpetuating racism at the individual, interpersonal, institutional, and cultural levels. The two-hour program, which Debby frequently presents at the White Privilege Conference, includes time for reflection, dialog, and Q&A.


Debby Irving is a racial justice educator and author.  A community organizer and classroom teacher for 25 years, Debby Irving grappled with racial injustice without understanding racism as a systemic issue or her own whiteness as an obstacle to it. 

As general manager of Boston\xe2\x80\x99s Dance Umbrella and First Night, and later as an elementary school teacher in Cambridge, Massachusetts, she struggled to make sense of tensions in racially mixed settings she could feel but could not explain. In 2009, Debby took a graduate school course, Racial and Cultural Identities, which gave her the answers she\xe2\x80\x99d been looking for and helped launch her on a journey of discovery. Now, leading workshops and presentations around the country, Debby devotes herself to exploring the impact white skin can have on perception and how individuals can help themselves and others change misconceptions and attitudes. 


Suggested donation $15 (cash or check). All donations will go to Colorado Immigrant Rights Coalition.


To request translation or childcare, please contact Paula Palmer at 240-595-5993 by May 30th."
NAME: I'm A Good Person, Isn't That Enough? with Debby Irving
ORGANIZER: Unitarian Universalist Church of Boulder, Colorado

DESCRIPTION:
b"Tired of feeling helpless watching videos and hearing news on the devastating circumstances given to innocent civilians in Syria? Looking for a way to give back? Join us as we get together for some Art & Action. Purchase your ticket, which will be going towards the IRC (International Rescue Committee). Founded in 1933 at the request of Albert Einstein, the IRC delivers lifesaving care to people fleeing conflict and natural disaster. Year after year, the IRC is one of the highest-ranking nonprofits for accountability, transparency, and efficient use of contributions.
Local celebrity artist Amelia ST will create a painting dedicated to the cause. You will have a chance to win one of her beautiful masterpieces while enjoying an open bar and hors d'oeuvres. 
WHEN: June 9th, 2017 six o'clock to ten o'clock
WHERE: Provisions No.14 
2100 14th St NW, Washington, DC 20009
PRICE: $25 ticket with a minimum of $50 donation"
NAME: A Night of Art & Action for Syria Featuring AmeliaST

DESCRIPTION:
b"Help Break the Isolation of Immigrants in Detention: 
Donate Stationery, Stamps, Funds for Phone Cards 
Just a short distance from the Statue of Liberty, there are more than 2,000 immigrants confined in detention centers and county jails. 
Many are held for months or years with severely restricted access to the outside world. Many have no money to purchase stationery, stamps, or phone cards to be able to contact their families and to seek documentation to prove their fear of persecution and need for the United States' protection. 
Help break their isolation! 
Your contribution of any of the following will boost immigration detainees' morale and perhaps even save their lives. THANK YOU! 
- Envelopes (letter or business) 
- Writing paper (white or colors) 
..."
NAME: Break the Isolation of Immigrants in Detention: Donate Statione

DESCRIPTION: b"A workshop led by immigrant advocates on best practices for filming, taking photographs, and taking notes to document ICE raids and other anti-immigrant actions. Learn what's legal and what's useful.\nThis is a grassroots networking and training event for people interested in supporting the immigrant community in Alabama. All who are motivated by love, justice, and mercy for vulnerable communities among us are welcome.\nThis series of Sanctuary movement trainings and conversations is a response to the pledge by the current administration to deport millions. The concept of Sanctuary in the Streets evolved to offer support to immigrants encountering ICE raids and intimidation tactics. This strategy focuses on showing up for undocumented people and other immigrants where they are in moments of crisis."
NAME: ICE Watch: A Sanctuary in the Streets Training Event

DESCRIPTION:
b"Join the Boulder County Protectors in a full day's training combining direct action 101 and 201 on the theory, use and application of nonviolent direct action to prevent fracking in Boulder County. 
The training will cover the basics of direct action and how it works to build political power while addressing the basic ideas and concerns of anyone new to this profound and historic strategy. 
We will also talk about the current situation in Boulder County regarding fracking and how we are organizing to ban fracking around community rights and the Climate Bill of Rights. 
People completing the training will be invited to to join our Boulder County Protectors Direct Action Implementation Strategy Sessions. Please join us for this full day's training. 
Bring a sack lunch because we will have a very short time for lunch 
Sunday, May from 12:00 to 6:00
Sliding scale of $30 - $100. No one turned away for lack of funds. Donations needed for continued trainings and for our legal defense fund. 
RSVP Required to

DESCRIPTION:
b'*THIS IS THE OFFICIAL MARCH DIRECTLY WORKING WITH THE EQUALITY MARCH IN WASHINGTON DC.
**View our pinned post.
The "Equality March for Unity & Pride" is a grassroots movement which will mobilize the diverse LGBTQ+ communities to peacefully and clearly address concerns about the current political landscapes and how it is contributing to the persecution and discrimination of LGBTQ+ individuals.
Progress has been made over the past decade in the ongoing fight for LGBTQ+ inclusion, access, and justice, but there's still so much more to be done \xe2\x80\x93 especially since the progress we've achieved is currently being threatened by increased hostile rhetoric, discriminatory policies, and violence perpetrated against the most vulne
rable in our communities.
We will use the Equality March, and sister events across the country, to give voice to our concerns, and to support, uplift, and bring attention to those in our communities who are targeted due to immigration status, ethnicity, religion, skin color, gender, and disability. We affirm and celebrate that we are a mix of diverse communities. Lack of unity has caused many of our needs to be neglected or ignored. But now, for 2017 and beyond, we are working to learn from our prior mistakes and come together through common belief in inalienable human rights and dignity for all.'
LOCATION: 1401 John F Kennedy Blvd, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania 19102

DESCRIPTION:
b"Join Emerge on June 23rd for our 5th Anniversary Party!   This great evening will be complete with cocktails, heavy hors d'oeuvres and all your favorite feminists!!
We'll kick the night off with an exciting guest speaker **TO BE ANNOUNCED** and then toast our incredible successes as we look forward to the next 5 years. 
Guests are invited to stay past 8 pm for a roller skating party, skates will be available for rental. 
--- 
In 2016, seven of eight Emerge women won in the General Election. It's critical that we sustain these successes and our momentum so we have the progressive infrastructure we need to win in 2018 and 2020. 
The work we're doing has never been more important than it is right now. In this dramatically shifted political and cultural landscape, women are coming forward in unprecedented numbers because they see discrimination, sexism, and a brand of politics defined by division taking over. They know their values and their voices are the solution their communities need. Play a part in making sure these incredible women have what they need to run and win, and please join us on the June 23rf! 
_________
Individual Tickets, $35
VIP Tickets*, $100
Tickets include one drink ticket. VIP tickets include 2 drink tickets and access to a meet and greet with our distinguished speaker.
Purchase your tickets today: 
https://act.myngp.com/Forms/2950000052016252672

DESCRIPTION: b'How do you talk to your students, children, and youth, about the impacts the current administration\'s policies have on their lives and experiences? Come to our free panel and discover what administrators, educators, and parents are doing to inform youth and help them build tools to speak out and contribute in their own way. Panelists will discuss what parents are observing, what schools can do to broach these thorny topics with young people, and how we might work with students to aid in the resistance.\nThis panel is part of a spring quarter course entitled \xe2\x80\x9cEducating for the Resistance," developed by the School of Education at Antioch University Seattle. The course explores the many ways people can contribute to the resistance and stay vigilant to ever-changing policies that effect our lives, climate, and economy.\nRSVP here: http://bit.ly/2oqmudB'
NAME: Youth & The Resistance Panel

DESCRIPTION: b'This is a page for building a transgender contingent that will march either in parallel to, or as part of the National Equality Pride March currently being organized. If there is one thing we have learned as transgender, non-binary, non-conforming, and intersex, individuals, it is that IT IS UP TO US to represent ourselves and fight for our basic human dignities.\nThis is not to say we do not have LGB allies, but we must mobilize ourselves first.\nOur contingent will welcome individuals of all identiites and expressions, including parents, siblings, children, family, and allies.'
NAME: National Trans March

This webinar will outline the Clean Air Act (CAA) authorities of the states, how the CAA is interpreted and applied, and what communities need to know to take advantage of this legal opportunity. Learn how some operators use incremental expansions of their pipeline infrastructure facilities to "game the system"\xe2\x80\x94that is, staying under major source thresholds while the facilities continue to grow year after year.
Check out other webinars in the series by clicking here: '
NAME: Webinar: Clean Air Act

DESCRIPTION:
b"Sponsored by Families of Color Monterey County, Family Biking Monterey County, and The Friends of the Marina Library join us as we celebrate LGBTQIA+ Pride Month! One month isn't enough time to explore the wide range of stories that exist but we intend to try! Please bring your favorite kids' books celebrating LGBTQIA+ folks of color, and at the end of the ride at Dennis The Menace Park we'll gather and share our families' favorites. All families welcome!
Knowing our history helps build a brighter future for all children and books are an excellent tool to help families understand, appreciate, and facilitate dialogue.
We will meet in the parking lot across from the Naval Post Graduate School in Monterey and head towards Dennis The Menace Park where we'll share the books our families have brought and watch our kids play! Don't have a bike? No worries! We'll do our best to keep the pace slow, so those on walking, rolling, and/or with strollers can keep up. If you want to just meet us at the park, that's also an excellent option. Hope to see you there!
Please note a helmet is required for all participants under 18 years of age. For recommendations and how to properly fit a helmet, please join the group: Family Biking Monterey County. We will have a couple pink/purple/orange Bell helmets (donated by the City of Monterey) that typically fit kids age 5-8 available to use during the ride. If you need one, please let us know ahead of time, so we can plan accordingly.
There are bathrooms at this location. However, there is no gender neutral availability. Please bring your own lunch. There is a picnic area. We recommend bringing your own blanket/chair as there are limited benches available around the playground area for seating. Also, bike parking is limited to just one rack (please bring a lock, if you need one) but we are working on having a local company provide valet service.
Founded by Families of Color Monterey County (FoCMC) in October of 2016, Family Biking Monterey County is a grassroots effort dedicated to making bicycling accessible and affordable through advocacy, education, and community building. Join the group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/FamilyBikingMC/"
NAME: Lgbtqia+ Pride Month Family Ride
Black Lives Matter New Member Orientation (for Black folks only)

 We will meet at 24th Street on the Boardwalk and Beach for some fun ! We will have some speakers, some music, some information from a lot of great groups.

DESCRIPTION:
b"There is more than sufficient cause for alarm about the role Russian state-led hacking and information warfare played in the 2016 election, and there are crucial unanswered questions about the relationship between the Russian state and Donald Trump, his associates and his campaign. The legitimacy of the United States government may hinge on the answers to these questions. If the President was elected even in part due to collusion with a foreign effort to interfere in our democratic process, then the will of the people has been subverted.
The President just fired the FBI Director, a highly concerning move that may be intended to thwart the ongoing FBI investigation into Russian interference and ties to Donald Trump and his associates. Congressional investigations in the House and Senate have been slow, under-resourced, and mired in partisan politics. Many Congressional leaders have called for an independent investigation, a special prosecutor or a commission to fairly investigate these concerns. Despite the clear will of the people, their calls have not been answered.
Therefore, we call for a #MarchForTruth to raise our voices and let our elected leaders know that the people want answers.
The legitimacy of our democracy is more important than the interests of any party, or any President. So, we will rise together to call for a fair and impartial investigation, for the pursuit of truth, and for the restoration of faith in our electoral system and the Office of the Presidency.
Across the country, peaceful demonstrations will be arranged on Saturday, June 3rd.
Our goals are simple:
1.) A special prosecutor must be named, an independent commission established and Congressional investigations should be properly resourced and pursued free of partisan interests.
2.) As much information should be made available to the public as possible, and as soon as possible.
3.) Congress should require Donald Trump to release his tax returns to clarify his business interests and obligations to any foreign entity.
4.) If crimes were committed or if collusion is discovered, it must be prosecuted.
________________
For more information, press inquiries, or to volunteer: 
[email\xc2\xa0protected]

DESCRIPTION: b"Every day innocent men and woman, children and old people are dying in Syria! They are not dying from famine, disease, or natural disaster. They are dying because a dictator wants to stay in power, because a mass murdered won't step down and allow a more competent person to run the country. I want people to march to create awareness, to show the world the misery Syrian people have to go threw every day. We may not be able to stop what going on but what are we if we don't try. Let's be the change we want to see on the world!"
NAME: One million human march to end the war in Syria

DESCRIPTION:
b"Join Great Basin Water Network, Progressive Leadership Alliance of Nevada, and Great Basin Resource Watch on a four day road-trip to learn from rural residents, local experts and Native leaders about the protection of water resources for current and future generations of people and wildlife.
Groups departing from Las Vegas and Reno on Thursday June 15th, will converge in Baker, NV on Friday the 16th for the weekend-long Snake Valley Festival.
Cost $150 per person for tent campers and $250 per person based on double occupancy for a motel or home rental (plus online transaction fee). Camping is available at the Great Basin National Park in Baker only. All participants will stay indoors on the first night in Eureka or Ely. This fee includes transportation, most lunches and lodging. A limited number of need-based scholarships are available. Participants are responsible for other meals and expenses.
Visit our event page for routes, regisration and payment information: 
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/great-basin-water-tour-tickets-32934321442
Deadline to register and pay participation fee: May 1st
Last day to cancel and receive full reimbursement: May 14th
Last day to cancel and receive partial reimbursement: May 30th
Great Basin Water Tour: June 15th - 18th
Contact Ellen Moore with any questions: 
[email\xc2\xa0protected]

DESCRIPTION:
b"When in the course of human events a President betrays his nation, we the People have a lawful right and responsibility to evict him from the White House, also known as The People's House.
We demand for President Trump to vacate the premises no later than July 4, 2017.  In doing so not only do we celebrate our historic independence day, we consecrate our re-independence from tyranny, from pseudo-monarchial abuses, and most importantly we declare our independence from Vladimir Putin and the Russian Federation!
As a lead up to the March for Truth on June 3rd demanding an independent investigation into the President's connections with Russia, we the People will petition our President with a list of grievances setting forward his unlawful actions, with a demand that he vacate the premises.  Using the link below you can download for print a copy of our Demand to Vacate.  Sign and mail to the President during the week of May 29th to June 2nd as a symbol to the President and all his political allies in the government that the People overwhelmingly are disturbed by the brazenly illegal actions we already know this President to be guilty of.
If you feel so inclined, bring another copy with you to the March for Truth DC so that we can deliver the notice to the White House personally.
Join us in this act of protest.  Spread the word, share with your friends.  It takes many drops of water to form an ocean.  A simple act on your part will help contribute to the building tidal wave of opposition against a corrupt President and foreign dominance.  Resist and persist!
http://potusstaff.com/r/p/s/potus-eviction.pdf"
NAME: POTUS Eviction!

Please RSVP using the Tickets Link!'

DESCRIPTION:
b'To change the balance of power and to move forward, we need smart, level-headed, hard-working, truthful, caring Democrats to run for office in all levels of our government. We need more leaders with integrity, ability and vision.


If you are a candidate, have been thinking about the possibility of a run for office, or want to learn more about campaign strategy, then this workshop is for you.


Join fellow Democrats for this day-long training. The workshop will introduce you to the nuts and bolts of running as a candidate and supporting a campaign.


Cost: $35 (includes lunch)

Pre-registration is required. Seating is limited to 40 participants. 


To register, use the Ticket Link above, or go to 

www.actblue.com/contribute/page/escambia-june3-training

Register no later than May 29 if you plan to attend. 


If you prefer, you may send your check for $35 (made out to  Escambia DEC). Mail to:  Escambia DEC, Training, P.O. Box 13123, Pensacola, FL 32591.  Checks must be received by May 25. 


Visit escambiademocrats.org for more information.


Facilitator Kevin Winchell currently serves as Training Director for the Volusia County Democratic Party and as the Associate Director for Community Engagement and the Bonner Program at Stetson University in Deland, Florida. Winchell is the Founder and Director of Stetson University\xe2\x80\x99s annual Politics 101 Conference. He also founded and is the Executive Director of Democracy Strategies.


Topics to be covered include:

\xe2\x80\xa2 A look at why you want to run. Can you win?

* Developing your campaign strategy 

* Developing your campaign message

* Preparing for your campaign

* Funding your campaign

* Reaching your voters

* Advanced data


Through training, we as Democrats can elect candidates who share our values. Through training, we can be part of a team that develops a smart, successful campaign.


Please share this event with fellow Democrats who you think could benefit.


This workshop is sponsored by the Escambia County Democratic Executive Committee.'
NAME: Democratic Candidate and Campaign Training

DESCRIPTION:
b"Easy to feel powerless in the face of overwhelming attacks every day from Trump and radical Republicans.
If you're feeling angry, afraid, or frustrated with where our country is headed, there's no better cure than mutual support of like-minded people.
Indivisible is empowering every day citizens with a plan and the tools to fight back effectively.
Both large group and breakout groups will continue to focus on specific ACTIONS we will take to do to Trump and Republicans what the Tea Party did to Obama and Democrats.
Bring a smartphone/laptop/pad if you have one!
We are Indivisible, we are organizing, and we are growing!"

DESCRIPTION: b'\xe2\x80\x9cThis is our chance to make a difference. A real difference. To show the world that we will we not tolerate anymore discrimination against our Juggalo brothers and sisters\xe2\x80\xa6. This march is a serious, peaceful public demonstration, organized for one purpose \xe2\x80\x94 to deliver a message to the world showing how Juggalos have been unfairly stigmatized and discriminated against simply for identifying as being part of a particular music-based subculture."In addition to the march, there will be an almost free ($1 per ticket) two-day concert at The Jiffy Lube Amphitheater in Bristow, VA, about 25 minutes outside of D.C., with performances by bands who have professed support for Juggalos throughout their struggle. The long list of performers currently includes ICP themselves, as well as Vanilla Ice and 2 Live Crew, among others.'
NAME: Juggalo march

DESCRIPTION:
b'All are welcome to join!
Dorchester People for Peace (DPP) is organizing a monthly, rush-hour "Standout for Black Lives" at Ashmont Station plaza every third Thursday of each month, 5:30 to 6:30 PM.  
We will hold a big banner that says \xe2\x80\x9cWe Believe that Black Lives Matter" and Black Lives Matter signs (including various issues that impact Black lives), and hand out fliers and talk to pedestrians and drivers stopped at red lights.
As a majority white organization, DPP wants to make our opposition to white supremacy visible - we hope you will join us.'
NAME: Dorchester Stand Out for Black Lives

The North Idaho Pride Alliance is proud to organize the 3rd annual Pride in the Park celebration. Pride in the Park is a FREE family-friendly community event that focuses on unifying our community by celebrating our talents, strengths and diversity within the LGBT community and ally groups in our greater Coeur d\xe2\x80\x99Alene area.


Headlining the live entertainment will be the Angela Marie Project and Kathy Colton and the Reluctants.  Food is provided by Big Bear Deli of Post Falls.   The children and family area is brought to you by local girl scouts.  


Sponsors of Pride in the Park include: Pride Foundation, OutSpokane, PFLAG Coeur d\xe2\x80\x99Alene, and AHA! Creative.  For more information on Pride in the Park, email the North Idaho Pride Alliance at 
[email\xc2\xa0protected]

DESCRIPTION:
b'Indy Pride Inc. is excited to announce the opening of early bird registration for this year's Rainbow 5k Run/Walk! With the changing political climate in D.C., there is no greater time to come together in solidarity and take to the streets to be visible in your support of the LGBTQ community.  This year 50% of the proceeds raised by this event will be donated to Indiana Youth Group's (IYG) \xe2\x80\x9cThe Power of Safe" capital campaign.  IYG is a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit that creates safe spaces, provides wellness programming, and educates LGBTQ youth and the community.  We hope you are able to join us for a morning of fun and exercise on Saturday, May 20th.  
Early bird pricing ($25) is available now until March 11, 2017.  To register, please visit www.getmeregistered.com/rainbowrunforpride. 
NEW COURSE, NEW PRICING, NEW T-SHIRT OPTIONS:
Due to the transitioning of our neighborhoods and businesses, Indy Pride has relocated this event.  This year the race will start/finish at the Indianapolis Fire Fighters Museum parking lot located at the corner of St. Clair and N. College Ave.  Please visit the \xe2\x80\x9ccourse section" on the registration page for course details.
Based on past participant feedback we are offering youth pricing for ages 13 and under.  Additionally, we have added youth t-shirt size options as well.  Lastly, we have expanded the adult t-shirt selection to include 2XL.  Youth and adult 2XL t-shirts will only be available to those who register online by May 7, 2017, and extras will NOT be ordered.  
How to get involved and make an impact: RSVP
\xe2\x80\xa2	Recruit friends, family and neighbors to participate 
\xe2\x80\xa2	Sponsor/Donate
\xe2\x80\xa2	Volunteer
\xe2\x80\xa2	Participate
On behalf of Indy Pride and myself, I want to thank you for your past and continued support!  We look forward to seeing you bright and early on Saturday, May 20th.
Cheers to health and wellness,'
NAME: Rainbow 5K Walk and Run

DESCRIPTION:
b"How is Maine's environment affected by current politics?

 There is great concern for our natural environment locally, statewide, and nationally. Maine Common Good Coalition, a Maine Congressional District 2 constituent group, is offering an evening of information, discussion, inspiration and action on how to protect our natural landscape. A diverse group of local and state environmental experts will be discussing a wide range of topics from climate change, to the EPA, and to the effects of the current administration on local ecosystems.

 Join us to be inspired to make a difference and be a voice for our Health, Clean Water, Clean Air and our Natural Life in Maine.

Our Panel includes: Glenn Brand, director of Sierra Club ~ Beth Ahearn, political director of Maine Conservation Voters ~ Emmie Theberge, Federal Project Director at NRCM ~ Kyle Winslow, Project Manager, Downeast Salmon Federation ~ Antonio Blasi, Hancock County Commissioner ~ John Anderson, Professor at College of The Atlantic, and more! Moderated by Stacy Leafsong, leader of Maine Common Good Coalition."
NAME: The Future of Our Forests, Rivers, Lakes, Fields and Ocean

DESCRIPTION: b'Join the Chester County Young Democrats on June 13th at Kennett Brewing Company Kennett Square, PA.  We are a group of progressive 40 and under looking to turn Chester County Blue. This is a laid back event. Learn how you can push back against tyranny, fight for equality, freedom, and justice. You will be able to network with likeminded progressives and learn how YOU can make a difference in taking our democracy back.\nThere is a free parking lot on Church Alley directly across from the back entrance. There is also the parking garage at East Linden, or metered street parking - both of which are free after 5pm Monday-Saturday\nAdmission is free but food and drinks are not included.'
LOCATION: 109 S Broad St, Ste 2, Kennett Square, PA, 19348
NAME: Chester County Young Democrats June Gathering

DESCRIPTION: b"No matter what happens in Washington, D.C., California Democrats are committed to fighting for our core values of truth, civility, and perseverance. With nearly 39 million people living within our borders, California will lead the nation in the fight to protect the dignity and basic human rights of all who live here. And our voices will be heard.\nCalifornia has led the way: creating millions more jobs, passing equal pay legislation, establishing a living wage, protecting our invaluable natural resources and expanding health care for all.\nThere's lots of work to do, so join us at the 2017 California Democrats State Convention where we'll elect our party's new administration and map out how we can continue to lead the nation in the fight for progress together."
NAME: 2017 California Democrats State Convention
